example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the navtitle element can provide a title for the map and a navigation title for a topic:
example.codeblock: <map> <topicmeta> <!-- 1. Applies a title for the map --> <navtitle>Developing a reuse strategy</navtitle> </topicmeta> <topicref keyref="developing-reuse-strategy"> <topicref keyref="define-business-requirements"/> <topicref keyref="prototype-sample-source"/> <topicref keyref="select-reuse-methods"/> <topicref keyref="test-reuse-methods"/> <topicref keyref="correct-reuse-strategy"> <topicmeta> <!-- 2. Applies a navigation title for the resource --> <navtitle>Refine reuse strategy</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> <!-- â€¦ --> </topicref> </map>
example.p: In the above code sample, the navtitle element appears twice:

ol.li: It supplies a title for the DITA map.
It supplies a navigation title of "Refine reuse strategy" for the resource referenced by the key "correct-reuse-strategy."
